answers.answer: Any chest discomfort that is experienced with exertion and associated with symptoms such as shortness of breath, jaw/neck/arm pain, sweating, nausea is concerning. If there are other medical risk factors such as hypertension, hyperlipidemia, diabetes, history of smoking, or a family history for heart disease, the suspicion for having a heart condition is heightened. If this has been happening on a continual basis then I would suggest further evaluation by your regular doctor for a thorough history and physical. However, there are a number of other conditions that can cause chest discomfort (muscle/skin disorders, lung problems, GI issues, etc), which must be carefully considered in the clinical context.

question: a couple nights ago I was up getting a snack for my husband and myself I gave him his plate and walked back to the kitchen to get mine and suddenly got a very intence pain in my chest left side just inder my breast I couldnt take a breath or move anything for about 2 mins then a pressure in the same spot like something was trying to come out of my chest eye brows slightly sweatty but other wise chilled to the bone finger tips numb and a tingling in my left leg from the knee down this gave me quite a scare but my husband said it wasnt a heart attack  but I am at a loss for what else it could be since I have a feeling like a bruise there and shoulder dis comfort any input would be helpfull
title: could it be a heart attack or heart related
